document.docAuthor: Lin, Meiying, Tavakilian, Gérard, Montreuil, Olivier & Yang, Xingke
document.masterDocTitle: Eight species of the genus Glenea Newman, 1842 from the Oriental Region, with description of three new species (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae: Saperdini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Eight species of the genus Glenea Newman, 1842 from the Oriental Region, with description of three new species (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae: Saperdini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Glenea ( Mesoglenea ) invitticollis
Breuning, 1956
: 99
. syn. nov.
Glenea ( Aridoglenea ) flavorubra :
Breuning, 1958
: 877
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Supplementary description. Male: length: 10.0– 10.7 mm , humeral width: 3.2–3.4 mm . Female: length: 12.4–15.2 mm , humeral width: 4.0– 4.7 mm . Antennae longer (male) or shorter (female) than body; antennomere ratio: male:
13 3 16
14 13 12
11 11 10
10 11 ; female:
16 4 23
16 14 12
12
11 10 9
10 . Prothorax not narrower from base to apex, very finely punctured. Legs stout, middle tibia grooved, hind femur reaching fourth abdominal segment, first hind tarsal segment slightly longer (male) or shorter (female) than following two segments combined. Male and female claws simple. Male terminalia (
Figs 46
a–c): Tegmen length about 2.3 mm ; lateral lobes slender, slightly narrower apically, each about 0.7 mm long and less than 0.15 mm wide, with a finely haired ridge at the base (in ventral view), apex with a few short setae; basal piece slightly bifurcated distally; median lobe plus median struts slightly curved, subequal to tegmen ( 22 : 23 ); median struts more than half of whole median lobe in length; dorsal plate shorter than ventral plate; apex of ventral plate rounded and slightly projected; median foramen elongated; internal sac more than 3 times as long as median lobe plus median struts, with 4 pieces of basal armature and 3 rods; longer ones each about 2.6 mm long, longer than tegmen. Tergite VIII (
Fig. 47
) with apex bluntly pointed, with short and sparse setae. Ventrite IX subequal to ringed part of tegmen in length. Female terminalia (
Fig. 48
): Spermathecal capsule composed of an apical orb and a stalk, stalk almost straight, about twice as long as apical orb.

Diagnosis. Differs from
G. nigrorubricollis
sp. nov
,
G. subrubricollis
sp. nov
and
G. rubricollis (Hope)
in having the third antennomere stouter and with obvious erect hair; elytron with only four pubescent maculae.

Remarks.
Breuning ( 1956 )
described the subgenus
Mesoglenea
diagnosed by antennomere 3 stout, with short erect hair; antennal insertions close to each other. Following careful comparison, we considered
G. (Mesoglenea) invitticollis
as a junior synonym of
G. flavorubra
.

Gressitt ( 1951 )
treated
G. flavorubra
in the subgenus
Stiroglenea
, without giving any reason, while
Breuning ( 1958 )
treated it in subgenus
Aridoglenea
, without examining any specimens. Further studies are warranted.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 43–45. Habitus,
G. flavorubra Gressitt.
43. holotype of
G. ( Mesoglenea )
invitticollis
Breuning
, female, from Vietnam. b. lateral view. c. dorsal view. 44. paratype of
G. flavorubra
Gressitt
, female, from Hainan. 45. male, from Hainan. h. head, frontal view.

FIGURES 46–48. Terminalia of
G. flavorubra
Gressitt.
46. male genitalia. a. ventral view. b. lateral view. c. dorsal view. 47. tergite VIII and ventrites VIII & IX. in ventral view. 48. spermathecal capsule. Scale 1 mm.
